description.para: The snmptrap module provides SNMP trap daemon support for reconnoiter. Reconnoiter comes with a snmptrap-based helper utility called noittrap aimed to assist with the complexities of forming valid SNMP traps to this module.

moduleconfig.parameter: The SNMP community string providing trap access.
The port on which traps are accepted.

checkconfig.parameter: The SNMP community string providing trap access (overrides modules config).

example.title: Simple passive checking.
example.para: The following example configures a check prepared to accept traps from host 10.1.1.1. Traps must be performed with the community name 's3cr3t'. Note that because this check is passive, the timeout and period mean nothing to reconnoiter. Though these values may be used by an upstream provider for fault detection.
example.programlisting: <noit> <modules> <module image="snmp" name="snmptrap"> <config> <community>s3cr3t</community> </config> </module> </modules> <checks> <check uuid="1b4e28ba-2fa1-11d2-883f-e9b761bde3fb" module="snmptrap" name="magic" period="60000" timeout="30000"/> </checks> </noit>
